title: The hidden human cost of Artificial Intelligence
content: AI’s efficiency and accuracy are built on the invisible labour of low-paid workers in developing countries. From data labelling to content moderation, ‘ghost workers’ face exploitation, insecurity, and mental health risks.

content: Tensions between India and Pakistan soared after terrorists killed 26 people, mostly civilians, in Jammu and Kashmir’s Pahalgam on April 22

title: Finance Ministry’s financial inclusion push sees 61 lakh new bank accounts, 2.6 crore insurance enrolments so far
content: Launched on July 1, 2025, the campaign was conducted by the Department of Financial Services with an aim to include every last person in the country under financial inclusion schemes.

content: Jammu and Kashmir Congress said the Union territory has suffered a “colossal damage” due to heavy rains and floods

title: Rajasthan surpasses target for millet outlets in rural areas
content: Rajasthan Government exceeds target, establishes 152 millet outlets to promote nutritious and sustainable food options in rural areas

content: The Pudukottai episode, according to Mr. Thirunavukkarasar, had caused a considerable gap between him and Karunanidhi. However, three years later, he and Karunanidhi patched up and the former went on to become an MP from the same constituency.

title: Tripura Government cancels licence of controversial Bar Club in Agartala
content: West Tripura District Magistrate said there was no permission given for organising a DJ party in the bar adjacent to the Rabindra Bhavan, which is attributed as a cultural landmark in Agartala city

content: The five-time Chief Minister condemns gang rape near Puri temple and criticises BJP’s failure to ensure women’s safety

content: Officials said a 300-metre patch in Udhampur was proving to be a major challenge for the authorities. The area has witnessed landslips and land subsidence in the past three weeks

title: After Indore, patients allege rat bites at Jabalpur medical college; probe launched
content: Jabalpur Collector Raghvendra Singh said that the district administration has issued notices to hospital authorities, seeking a status report on the incident within three days

title: Hyderabad rains: Afzal Sagar erased, flash floods now fill the void
content: Once a major lake, it has vanished under decades of encroachment and neglect; with its natural drainage lost, the area repeatedly faces heavy flooding, the latest having swept away two youth

title: PM To Launch 'Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan' As He Turns 75 Today
content: The Central government will launch 'Swasth Nari, Sashakt Parivar Abhiyaan' along with the 'Poshan Maah' on September 17. The AIIMS Delhi will be organising Medical checkup camps at four centres.

title: Khalistani Outfit Announces Siege On Indian Consulate In Vancouver
content: As India and Canada resume diplomatic ties, Sikhs for Justice (SFJ), a US-based Khalistani outfit, has threatened to "siege" the Indian Consulate in Vancouver.

title: "Support Peace Efforts In Ukraine": PM Modi To Trump After Birthday Message
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday extended his support to the United States' efforts to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: "Emergency Measures Needed": India Inc Flags Bengaluru Civic Issues
content: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, executive chairperson of Biocon and a key voice of India Inc., has called for "emergency measures" to address civic issues in Bengaluru after the CEO of a trucking company announced plans to relocate from the Outer Ring Road

title: PM Modi Birthday Live Updates | "Right Leader At Right Time": Wishes Pour In As PM Modi Turns 75
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is celebrating his 75th birthday today. He was born on September 17, 1950 in Vadnagar, a small town in North Gujarat's Mehsana district.

title: Second Wave Of Floods Hits Assam, Over 22,000 Affected, 2 Dead In Golaghat
content: Torrential rains over the past three days have triggered a second wave of floods in Assam this monsoon season, affecting more than 22,000 residents and claiming two lives in the last 24 hours. The fatalities were reported from Golaghat district

title: "No Cluster Of" Brain-Eating Amoeba Cases, Clarifies Kerala Health Minister
content: Kerala's health authorities have issued a high alert after a significant spike in cases of Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM), a deadly brain infection caused by the "brain-eating amoeba" (Naegleria fowleri).

title: "Wanted To Distract": Man Who Falsely Claimed He Shot Charlie Kirk
content: The 71 year-old man who approached the cops immediately after Charlie Kirk was killed and yelled, "I shot him, now shoot me", told investigators that he was trying to "draw attention from the real shooter," according to a report.

title: "Killed Charlie Kirk Because....": What Accused Tyler Robinson Told Partner
content: Tyler Robinson, the man suspected of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, allegedly confessed to committing the crime in a series of texts to his transgender partner after the shooting, according to court documents.

title: "Must Treat Them Like Al Qaedas": FBI Chief On Drug Trafficking Organisations
content: Drug trafficking organisations must be treated the way foreign terrorist organisations were treated after the September 11, 2001, attacks, FBI Director Kash Patel said on Tuesday, pledging that the campaign against them will be a years-long mission.

title: Amid Trade Tensions, Negotiations And A Thaw, Trump Wishes PM Modi On Birthday
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi thanked US President Donald Trump for his wishes ahead of the former's 75th birthday, stressing his commitment to bettering India-US ties.

title: 15 Dead In Uttarakhand, 3 In Himachal, More Rainfall Expected Today
content: Overflowing rivers, caved roads, damaged houses, overturned vehicles - these are the visuals from Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh as the two states witness heavy rainfall. Fifteen people have died in Uttarakhand, and three in a landslide in Mandi.

title: All You Need To Know About TikTok, Its Algorithm, And US-China Deal
content: A central question to TikTok's potential shutdown saga has been whether the popular social video platform would keep its algorithm - the secret sauce that powers its addictive video feed - after it's divested from Chinese parent company ByteDance.

title: From Viral Sensation To Trump Target: How TikTok Became Caught In US-China Tensions
content: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that the U.S. and China have a deal that would keep TikTok operating in the United States, in an agreement that marks a breakthrough in months-long talks between the world's two biggest economies.

title: "A Lot Of 'BS'": Hardeep Puri On Claims Of Biofuels Damaging Engines
content: Oil Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday dismissed claims of biofuels damaging automobile engines as rubbish and said petrol blended with 20 per cent ethanol is environmentally safe to use.

title: Maoists Offer "Temporary Suspension Of Armed Struggle", Call For Talks With Centre
content: The banned CPI Maoists, operating from shadows for decades, depleting the country of its life blood, are apparently suing for peace - cornered after sustained crackdown by security forces

title: MK Stalin Urges PM Modi To Address Fertiliser Shortage In Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to immediately ensure the supply of fertilisers to the State, warning that farmers could face a severe shortage during the crucial Kharif season.

title: "Retired Judges Have To Beg For Facilities": Top Court To Centre On Tribunals
content: The Supreme Court flagged the lack of proper facilities as the reason behind the retired judges feeling discouraged.

title: Kerala HC expresses concern on ‘missing details’ of gold used for cladding Dwarapalaka idols at Sabarimala temple
content: If the copper plates were indeed cladded with gold, records must exist documenting the same, including the exact quantity of gold used, since traditional methods were followed.

title: Pawan Kalyan calls for strict vigilance on forces trying to create social unrest in A.P.

content: There has been a sharp increase in drone sightings and recoveries of narcotics in border districts such as Amritsar, Tarn Taran, Ferozpur and Gurdaspur

title: Diarrhoea in Vijayawada: water sample reports expected in two days, say analysts
content: Of 333 total reported cases, 34 patients are undergoing treatment; all patients are stable and no deaths have been reported so far, says NTR District Collector

title: Expert team constituted to inquire into incident wherein a guidewire was not removed after thyroidectomy surgery
content: Though the patient underwent the surgery on March 30, 2023, it was during a follow-up appointment for thyroid cancer in March 2025 that the guidewire showed up in an Xray

content: Roads are full of potholes and dust, coupled with the lowest intent to get them rectified. Don’t see any of this changing in the next five years, wrote company CEO Yabaji on X

content: The CM said that institutional delivery was low till a few years ago and sought to know how people born at their homes would provide birth certificates for the SIR

title: India’s education sector most vulnerable for cyberattacks: Check Point
content: Organisations in India experienced 3,237 cyberattacks per week in the month of August 2025 while global enterprises faced an average of 1,994 cyber attacks per week in the same month

title:
Change in PMK’s registered address is an attempt to hoodwink people, says 
G.K. Mani
content: The senior leader alleges that the permanent address of the party is at Teynampet, Chennai, but this has been changed in an attempt to hoodwink the people. It amounts to cheating

content: The decision to resume the yatra comes two days after a group of pilgrims staged a protest at Katra base camp in support of their demand for resumption of the pilgrimage.

content: All government files must be uploaded online within two months, with forensic auditing tools to prevent manipulation, he says, adding that Data Lake will be operational by November

content: Seattle's Cal Raleigh broke Mickey Mantle's record for homers by a switch-hitter then tied Ken Griffey Jr. for most home runs in franchise history in the next at-bat.

content: The Fever proved their resilience yet again, proving they aren't done yet after a 77-60 throttling of the Dream on Tuesday to force a winner-take-all Game 3.

content: Eagles left tackle Jordan Mailata has had enough of the media narrative that his team won Sunday's Super Bowl rematch against the Chiefs because of the tush push.

title: NFL: Brady didn't violate rules in Raiders booth
content: Tom Brady did not violate any NFL rules by wearing a headset in the Raiders' coaching booth during Monday night's game, the NFL announced.

content: The Vikings placed running back Aaron Jones on injured reserve Tuesday because of a hamstring injury, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Gators' Juluke gets 3 games for role in LSU scuffle
content: Florida suspended assistant coach Jabbar Juluke for three games for his role in an altercation before last Saturday's game against LSU.

title: Mbappé on 50th Madrid goal: I do what Xabi asks
content: Kylian Mbappé said he's happy to follow coach Xabi Alonso's instructions -- and work hard off the ball -- to "help the team win trophies" after scoring twice in Real Madrid's 2-1 comeback Champions League win against Marseille on Tuesday.

content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

content: Subs Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard powered Arsenal past Athletic Club on Tuesday, showing off the depth needed to win the Champions League.

content: Here's how Tuesday's action unfolded. Real Madrid hung on, while Juventus and Dortmund provided entertainment.

content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

content: Eric Karabell updates his fantasy rankings at every position for the remainder of the season, including his top 100 overall.

content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

content: The Dallas Wings star is the seventh former UConn player and 16th No. 1 overall draft pick to earn the honor.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Crawford takes over super middleweight; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford's win over Canelo Alvarez reshapes the 168-pound division. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Francisco Lindor homers shortly after wife, Katia, performs national anthem on violin
content: Katia Lindor minored in music at St. Mary's University in Texas and is a classically trained violinist.

title: Ovechkin cereal hits shelves with nods to Capitals star's career
content: 'Ovi's Great Crunch' will be available exclusively at Giant Food stores in the Washington, D.C., area.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Man City eyeing Guéhi
content: Crystal Palace's Marc Guéhi is wanted by clubs such as Liverpool and Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: Watch: Trump, Epstein images flash on Windsor castle walls as US President visits
content: Donald Trump's UK visit is met with controversy as protestors project images linking him to Jeffrey Epstein onto Windsor Castle, leading to arrests. Demonstrations are planned in London as Trump prepares for talks with King Charles III and Prime Minister Keir Starmer. The visit occurs amidst scrutiny of Trump's past ties to Epstein and recent dismissal of the UK ambassador to Washington over similar links.

title: 'Life imprisonment' for stray dogs who bite humans twice in Uttar Pradesh
content: Following a surge in dog bite incidents, Uttar Pradesh has implemented new rules for managing aggressive stray dogs. The policy mandates observation, sterilization, and microchipping for unprovoked biters, with repeat offenders facing shelter confinement unless adopted. A committee will determine provocation, and behavioral training will be provided to address stress-related aggression, balancing public safety and animal welfare.

title: LPG runs dry, WiFi cut: Delhi Police constable's son thrashes mother to death in rage
content: In Jaipur's Kardhani, Naveen Singh, 31, has been arrested for allegedly murdering his mother, Santosh, 52. A disturbing video captured Singh's brutal assault in the kitchen, even as his father, a Delhi Police constable, and sisters tried to intervene. The incident occurred after an argument over the internet connection and an empty LPG cylinder escalated, leading to the fatal attack.

title: Google CEO on Microsoft, Meta poaching, says individual cases can make headlines
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai addressed concerns about AI talent poaching from Google DeepMind amidst rising competition from Microsoft, Meta, and OpenAI. Despite high-profile departures and increasing costs to stay competitive, Pichai remains confident in Google's retention metrics and the influx of new talent.

title: How much revenue will Pakistan lose if they pull out of the Asia Cup?
content: Pakistan's threat to withdraw from the Asia Cup over a referee dispute could cost them millions in revenue, potentially jeopardising their financial stability within the Asian Cricket Council. This potential decision, driven by PCB chief Naqvi's criticism of the match referee, risks a significant loss from broadcast deals and sponsorships.

title: Rs 50 crore for Congress MLAs, Rs 25 crore for BJP’s: Uneven road funds for Bengaluru sparks outcry
content: The Siddaramaiah government in Bengaluru has sparked controversy by disbursing road repair funds unevenly, allocating ₹50 crore to constituencies with Congress MLAs and ₹25 crore to those with BJP MLAs. This decision has drawn sharp criticism from opposition parties, who allege it is discriminatory and will hinder development in their constituencies.

title: Hard work vs insane work: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang’s old remark; Elon Musk responds
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's rigorous work ethic, characterized by 5 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. workdays, has resurfaced, drawing admiration from the tech world. Elon Musk lauded Huang's dedication as 'Hardcore,' highlighting his own intense work habits. Both billionaires are at the forefront of AI innovation, with Huang leading Nvidia and Musk spearheading Tesla's AI chip partnership.

title: ‘No intent, no negligence’: Accused Gaganpreet files bail plea in Delhi BMW accident case
content: Gaganpreet Makkad, accused in the fatal BMW accident, filed a bail application claiming no intent or negligence. The victim, Navjot Singh's body was taken to his injured wife in the hospital, resulting in a heartbreaking scene. Investigations reveal Makkad transported the couple to a hospital owned by her relatives, raising questions about the choice of facility.

title: Clash with Booker, shouting contest with Schiff: Watch Kash Patel’s Senate hearing
content: FBI Director Kash Patel's Senate oversight hearing devolved into a partisan spectacle, marked by heated exchanges and personal insults. Democrats accused Patel of undermining the FBI's integrity and carrying out a political agenda, while Republicans praised him as a reformer. The contentious session also addressed recent FBI firings and Patel's handling of the Charlie Kirk case.

title: PM Modi turns 75: Wishes pour in; BJP kicks off ‘Sewa Pakhwada’ across country
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday with the launch of welfare programs and greetings from global leaders. US President Donald Trump lauded Modi's efforts towards resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict, while Russian Ambassador Denis Alipov acknowledged his contributions to strengthening India-Russia relations. President Murmu wished Modi success in leading India to greater progress.

title: TikTok goes American: Deal Struck; but China may still keep control
content: A tentative agreement has been reached between the US and China regarding TikTok's operations in America. ByteDance would reduce its stake to below 20 percent, transferring control to a US consortium. However, the fate of TikTok's algorithm remains a sticking point, with China seeking to license it, conflicting with US demands for complete divestiture.

title: Puja Khedkar’s family 'vanishes' after 'abduction' of trucker
content: Maharashtra police are searching for the family of Puja Khedkar after her father, Dilip Khedkar, and his driver allegedly abducted a truck helper following a road rage incident near Navi Mumbai. The victim was rescued from their Pune bungalow. Police accuse Manorama Khedkar, Puja's mother, of obstructing the investigation by helping the men escape and unleashing dogs on the police.

title: Which popular Indian fruit helps reduce cholesterol and keeps your heart healthy?
content: Multiple scientific investigations demonstrate that amla decreases LDL cholesterol through different mechanisms.The enzyme HMG-CoA reductase which produces cholesterol in the liver, experiences suppression through amla consumption. The liver produces less new cholesterol when this enzyme is blocked

title: White nights: Shubhanshu Shukla’s surreal ISS view; science meets wonder
content: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, India's first on the ISS, experienced 'white nights' during the Axiom-4 mission, where the sun never fully set. This phenomenon, caused by the station's beta angle, challenged the crew's sense of time and routine. Besides the awe, persistent sunlight posed operational hurdles, affecting cooling and solar array stress.

title: Asia Cup| 'Don't blame Indian cricketers, they were given orders': Afridi on handshake row
content: Shahid Afridi has criticised the Indian cricket team for allegedly refusing post-match handshakes after their Asia Cup victory against Pakistan, citing a lack of sportsman spirit. Afridi suggests the players were instructed by the BCCI due to social media pressure and national sentiments.

title: Black student found hanging at US university: Classes cancelled amid lynching fears
content: The death of Demartravion “Trey” Reed, a Black student found hanging from a tree at Delta State University, has sparked outrage and demands for an independent investigation. Despite police claims of no foul play, Reed's family, supported by civil rights attorney Ben Crump, seeks transparency and answers, citing communication failures and Mississippi's history of racial violence.

title: Youth hacked to death in Tamil Nadu by lover’s relatives
content: In Mayiladuthurai, a 28-year-old Dalit man was brutally murdered by relatives of his girlfriend, who disapproved of their decade-long relationship. The victim, K Vairamuthu, was attacked while returning home, leading to protests and demands for justice, including invoking the SC/ST Act against the girl's mother, who allegedly instigated the crime.

title: Will Pak play in the Asia Cup today or withdraw? PCB makes position clear
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board is contemplating withdrawing from the Asia Cup due to a dispute over match referee Andy Pycroft following the India-Pakistan match. Pakistan demands Pycroft's removal, accusing him of mishandling the no-handshake incident and Suryakumar Yadav's dedication of the win to the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: After 3 days of ‘digital arrest’, Hyderabad retired doctor dies of heart attack
content: A 76-year-old retired doctor in Hyderabad tragically died of a heart attack after enduring three days of relentless harassment by cyber fraudsters posing as law enforcement. The scammers extorted Rs 6.6 lakh from her under the guise of a 'digital arrest' and continued their threats even after her death. Police have registered a case and are investigating the cybercrime.

title: Mumbai Monorail blow: Third shutdown in 8 years; services suspended from Sept 20
content: Mumbai's Monorail will suspend operations from September 20 for a system overhaul, announced MMRDA, following frequent breakdowns. This shutdown, the third in eight years, aims to integrate new 'Make in India' rakes, commission advanced signalling, and refurbish the ageing fleet. Deputy CM Eknath Shinde emphasized that this vital step will strengthen Mumbai's transport.

title: ‘Scripted!’: Are Tyler Robinson’s texts with his trans partner fake?
content: Text messages released in the Charlie Kirk assassination case have sparked controversy, with figures like Candace Owens alleging they are doctored. Online skepticism focuses on the messages' language and tone, questioning their authenticity. Prosecutors maintain the texts, along with DNA evidence and a confession note, link Tyler Robinson to the crime, while Robinson remains silent amidst the allegations.

title: FaZe Clan fallout: From co-founder Temperrr’s removal to misconduct claims
content: FaZe Clan has severed ties with co-founder Thomas “Temperrr” Oliveira following serious allegations of inappropriate conduct. This decision ends a decade-long partnership that significantly shaped the esports organization. Former member FaZe Rain detailed the allegations, prompting widespread community discussion about ethical standards and accountability within esports leadership. Temperrr has expressed shock over his sudden removal.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens near 25,300; BSE up almost 150 points, crosses 82,500
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Wednesday after a strong market rally on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,250, BSE Sensex was up almost 150 points.

title: ‘Remember how I was engraving bullets?’: Kirk killer’s chilling texts to partner
content: Tyler Robinson is accused of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk. Robinson reportedly confessed to his partner via text. The messages reveal planning and motive. Robinson worried about a rifle used in the shooting. The rifle was a family heirloom. Robinson's DNA was found on the weapon. He asked his partner to delete messages. Robinson was arrested after a standoff.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for September 17 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers, Godrej Properties and Panacea Biotech are promising buys. Godrej Properties, after a year-long correction, shows a double-bottom pattern near long-term support, targeting ₹2,250 within 3-6 months. Panacea Biotech is poised for a breakout above ₹438, potentially reaching ₹476, supported by a strong base and consolidation above the 200 DEMA.

title: Aishwarya, Abhishek didn't comment on divorce speculations: Prahlad Kakkar
content: Even as there were divorce rumours, Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan maintained a dignified silence. The silently proved that they are together and remained unaffected by all the speculations. Now adman Prahlad Kakkar has opened up on their equation and steered clear on the rumours.

title: More twists in handshake row! Match referee Pycroft unlikely for Pak vs UAE
content: Amidst controversy, ICC match referee Andy Pycroft may be replaced for the Pakistan-UAE match following PCB's complaint regarding his conduct during the India game, which led to a "no-handshake" issue. The PCB demanded Pycroft's removal from the Asia Cup, threatening to pull out of the tournament.

title: Asia Cup: Mohammad Yousuf cites 'barking like a dog' remark on Afridi
content: Following Suryakumar Yadav's no-handshake gesture, former Pakistani player Mohammad Yousuf used derogatory language, sparking outrage. Yousuf defended his comments by referencing past incidents. Amidst heightened tensions and a complaint from the PCB regarding the match referee, the India-Pakistan match proceeded, with India winning. Despite threats, Pakistan is unlikely to withdraw from the Asia Cup.

title: Trump lands in UK: Trade, Ukraine war and meeting with King Charles – what’s on agenda
content: Donald Trump's state visit to the UK commenced amidst royal welcomes, trade agreements, and political debates. Hosted by King Charles III, Trump aims to strengthen transatlantic ties through discussions with Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer. The visit includes a "Tech Prosperity Deal" with significant US investments, but also faces protests and disagreements over foreign policy, particularly regarding the Ukraine conflict.

title: 'Vomiting, low blood pressure': Jair Bolsonaro hospitalised; son confirms 'emergency'
content: Jair Bolsonaro, Brazil's former president, was hospitalized while under house arrest due to severe hiccups, vomiting, and low blood pressure, according to his son Flavio. This health emergency follows Bolsonaro's recent sentencing to 27 years in prison for plotting a coup after his 2022 election defeat.

title: Prahlad Kakkar on Salman's obsession with Aishwarya, 'I'd bang my head'
content: Prahlad Kakkar revealed Salman Khan's obsessive behavior towards Aishwarya Rai during their relationship, witnessing scenes in their building. He described Salman's actions, including creating disturbances and banging his head on the wall. Kakkar noted the breakup's impact on Aishwarya's emotional well-being and career, highlighting her feeling of being unfairly judged by the industry.

title: Trump-Modi phone call: US President extends birthday wishes; PM thanks 'friend'
content: PM Modi and President Trump aimed to improve India-US relations after recent tensions, with Trump calling to wish Modi a happy birthday and discuss bilateral cooperation, including trade agreement negotiations. Modi expressed gratitude and supported Trump's efforts to resolve the Russia-Ukraine conflict. This conversation marks a potential turning point after the US imposed tariffs on India for Russian oil purchases.

title: Asia Cup: How Pak, Bangladesh, Afg and Sri Lanka can reach the Super 4 – Explained
content: The Asia Cup 2025 group stage intensifies as Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, and Afghanistan vie for Super 4 spots from Group B. Bangladesh's fate hinges on Afghanistan's clash with Sri Lanka, a virtual knockout. In Group A, India advances, while Pakistan and UAE face a decisive match for the remaining spot, promising high-stakes drama.

title: Netflix NFL: From Ian Eagle and Nate Burleson to Matt Ryan return
content: Netflix is set to deliver a Christmas football doubleheader with a star-studded broadcast team. Ian Eagle and Nate Burleson will cover the Commanders-Cowboys game, joined by Matt Ryan. Drew Brees and Noah Eagle will call the Vikings-Lions matchup, bringing a mix of experience and fresh perspectives to the holiday games. Sideline reporters and studio crew details are expected soon.

title: Aishwarya Rai’s breakup with Salman Khan: Prahlad Kakkar reveals emotional toll
content: Ad filmmaker Prahlad Kakkar recently revealed Aishwarya Rai's emotional state following her 2002 breakup with Salman Khan. Kakkar disclosed that Aishwarya felt betrayed by the film industry's perceived bias towards Salman. According to Kakkar, Aishwarya was more affected by the industry's abandonment than the breakup itself, as she felt the truth was on her side.

title: BlackBuck CEO’s rant: Rajesh Yabaji says 'breakup' with Bengaluru over potholes
content: BlackBuck, a Bengaluru-based IT company, is relocating from Bellandur due to severely potholed roads and agonizing commutes. CEO Rajesh Kumar Yabaji cited the deteriorating infrastructure and lack of improvement as reasons for the move.

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: the deal includes two-night events, such as WrestleMania and SummerSlam, plus other WWE premium live events . the event will mark the first premium live event (PLE) from WWE on ESPN . pre-show coverage starts at 5 p.m. ET .

title: Indiana-Illinois and under-the-radar games in the College Football Playoff hunt
content: two teams are set to meet in front of a sold-out crowd . one team made the college football Playoff in 2024 . the other won 10 games last season, finished no. 16 in AP poll . both coaches have won championships and individual awards .

title: NFL Week 3 betting: Odds, lines and totals for every game
content: the Miami Dolphins host the Buffalo Bills on "Thursday Night Football" on tuesday . a matchup of undefeated teams will feature the New York Giants and the Kansas City Chiefs . the team is the biggest favorite on the week 3 slate .

title: Buzz: Don't be fooled by Chubb's box score; how backups affect Jets, Vikings, Commanders
content: the fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . Nick Chubb finished with 14 touches and 15.2 fantasy points against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers . he averaged just 3.7 yards per carry, and that includes his 25-yard touchdown run late in the game .

title: Tatiana Suarez back on track in wide-open strawweight top 10
content: Tatiana Suarez beats Amanda lemos at Noche UFC on saturday . the 115-pound wrestler is in need of a first challenger . suarez will challenge Valentina Shevchenko for a belt on Nov. 15 .

title: Top players discuss playoff format, cheat meals, hype-up music
content: the NHL is close to being back in action for the 2025-26 season . a new collective bargaining agreement has been signed between the league and the players . "cheat meals," pregame pump-up tunes and weird equipment quirks are among the favorites .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Las Vegas moves on, six other teams still alive in Round 1
content: the WNBA playoffs are underway, but no team is going quietly . both the Seattle Storm and Indiana Fever won to force their series to a decisive Game 3 . the longest winning streak in the series came to an end .

title: Government checking veracity of ‘surrender offer’ by Maoists
content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood.
